member.summary: Creates a with the specified and .
member.exception: Selected file is null.
Selected file is empty string, contains only white space, contains one or more invalid characters, or refers to a non-file device.
Selected file refers to a non-file device.
Selected file cannot be found, such as when mode is FileMode.Truncate or FileMode.Open, and the file specified by path does not exist. The file must already exist in these modes.
An I/O error occurred or the stream has been closed.
The caller does not have the required permission.
Selected file is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified path, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file or directory is set for read-only access.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified mode contains an invalid value.

member.summary: Defines the basic methods of a generic FileDialogs DragDropBehavior.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.GetDragDropEffects(`0)
member.summary: Returns the DragDropEffects for the current drag drop operation. The return value affects the mouse cursor.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: This method is called only in the context of the drop target control.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.CanStartDrag(`0)
member.summary: Returns a value specifying whether the drag operation can be started.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.returns: True if the drag operation can be completed, otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is called only in the context of the drag source control.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.CanDrop(`0)
member.summary: Returns a value specifying whether the current drag operation can be completed.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.returns: True if the drag operation can be completed, otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is called only in the context of the drop target control.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.CoerceDraggedItems(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, filters the dragged items collection if necessary.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: This method is called immediately before the drag operation starts. Only the Items property of the DragDropState is valid.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.DragDropCanceled(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class cleans up a cancelled drag operation. This method is called only in the context of the drag source control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: This method is called only when the drag operation is cancelled by the user. If this method is called, the source's DragDropCompleted and target's Drop methods are not called.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.DragDropCompleted(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class completes the drag operation. This method is called only in the context of the drag source control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: When the drag source and the drop target are the same control, this method is called after Drop. This method is called only when the drag operation completed successfully. If this method is called, DragDropCanceled is not called.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.Drop(`0)
member.summary: Completes the drop operation. This method is called only in the context of the drop target control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.IsCopyingItems(`0)
member.summary: Returns true if the dragged files should be copied to the DropFolder, otherwise false.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.FileDialogs.DragDrop.DragDropBehavior`1.IsLinkingItems(`0)
member.summary: Returns true if a shortcut to the dragged files should be created in the DropFolder, otherwise false.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.

Selected file cannot be found, such as when mode is FileMode.Truncate or FileMode.Open, and the file specified by path does not exist. The file must already exist in these modes.
An I/O error occurred or the stream has been closed.
The caller does not have the required permission.
Selected file is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified path, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file or directory is set for read-only access.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified mode contains an invalid value.
